ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: ACDS: Age of onset of childhood symptoms
Notes: 1=Not present; 2 = Onset of symptoms since 12 years of age; 3 = Some hyperactive-impulsive or inattentive symptoms that caused impairment were present before age 12; 9 = inadequate information

ElementDescription: ACDS: Specify age of onset of childhood symptoms (in years)
ACDS Number of Inattention Symptoms in childhood
Notes: Number of childhood inattentive symptoms coded as ''moderate'' or ''severe''

ElementDescription: ACDS Number of Hyperactive/Impulsive Symptoms in childhood
Notes: Number of childhood hyperactive-impulsive symptoms coded as ''moderate'' or ''severe''

ElementDescription: ACDS Total Number of Symptoms in childhood
Notes: Total number of childhood symptoms coded as ''moderate'' or ''severe''

ElementDescription: ACDS Total Severity of Inattention Symptoms in childhood
Notes: Sum responses for childhood inattention symptoms to obtain severity

ElementDescription: ACDS Total Severity of Hyperactive/Impulsive Symptoms in childhood
Notes: Sum responses for childhood hyperactive-impulsive symptoms to obtain severity

ElementDescription: ACDS Total Symptom Severity in childhood
Notes: Sum responses for all childhood symptoms to obtain severity
